pull.title: rpc: Remove cs_main lock from blockToJSON and blockheaderToJSON
pull.body:
Motivated by https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11913#discussion_r157798157, this pull makes `blockToJSON` and `blockheaderToJSON` free of `cs_main` locks.

Locking `cs_main` was required to access `chainActive` in order to check if the block was in the chain and to retrieve the next block index.

With the this approach, `CBlockIndex::GetAncestor()` is used in a way to check if the block belongs to the specified chain tip and, at the same time, get the next block index.

issue.title: Avoid cs_main during ReadBlockFromDisk Calls
issue.body: Built on #11281 and one commit from #11824, this removes almost all cs_main holds in ReadBlockFromDisk calls in net_processing/RPC/REST. Only real worry here is if something gets pruned out from under us during reading, so some previously-asserts in net_processing are now LogPrints.

issue.title: Avoid permanent cs_main lock in getblockheader
issue.body: This PR reduces the `cs_main` lock scope in `getblockheader` RPC.

events.body: Generally wouldn't bother too much reducing cs_main scope when its really a trivial amount of time running with cs_main held, though I agree in the context of #11913 it makes sense to not lock cs_main and then unlock, then re-lock it there.
Changed the order in the signature and forgot to change callers.

Rebased mainly due to recent change from `push_back(Pair())` to `pushKV()`.

Also reworded to replace prefix `[rpc]` to `rpc:` as per @laanwj suggestion.

Rebased.

@MarcoFalke like @TheBlueMatt said above:

> in the context of #11913 it makes sense to not lock cs_main and then unlock, then re-lock it there.

I'd say at least let's wait for that.

utACK e20f745d9b279de9e43994505731658f0f3582fa, just whitespace fix since last review

issue.title: Track best-possible-headers (TheBlueMatt)
issue.body:
Rebase of #12138:

> This adds a `setBlockIndexHeaderCandidates` which mimics `setBlockIndexCandidates` and is
The set of all leaf `CBlockIndex` entries with` BLOCK_VALID_TREE` (for itself and all ancestors) and
as good as our current tip or better. Entries here are potential future candidates for insertion
into `setBlockIndexCandidates`, once we get all the required block data. Thus, entries here
represent chains on which we should be actively downloading block data.
>
> Note that we define "as good as our current tip or better" slightly differently here than in
setBlockIndexCandidates - we include things which will have a higher nSequence (but have the
same chain work) here, but do not include such entries in setBlockIndexCandidates. This is
because we prefer to also download towards chains which have the same total work as our current
chain (as an optimization since a reorg is very possible in such cases).
>
> Note that, unlike `setBlockIndexCandidates`, we only store "leaf" entries here, as we are not as
aggressively prune-able (`setBlockIndexCandidates` are things which we can, and usually do, try to connect immediately, and thus entries dont stick around for long). Thus, it may be the case that
`chainActive.Tip()` is NOT in `setBlockIndexHeaderCandidates`.
>
> Additionally, unlike setBlockIndexCandidates, we are happy to store entries which are not
connectable due to pruning here.
>
> This is useful as it (finally) disconnects net_processing logic from the "store on disk" logic in validation.cpp. More importantly, it represents what you'd need from the consensus logic to implement a spv-first sync mode, as this provides a best-header which will follow invalidity - always pointing to the best-possible header even after block(s) are found to be invalid.

Not included:
* #13912 (test framework change)
* #13930 (source code comment which is useful on its own)
* a9db3dada0119c183d16627805e90c4dbca05c6a "Do not unlock cs_main in ABC unless we've actually made progress": already merged as part of #13023

Noteble rebase changes:
* `pindex_was_in_chain` is still needed due to  #12431, in order to notify the gui about a new block tip, only if the active chain was modified
* `qt/clientmodel.cpp` changed significantly, because things were moved to `interfaces/node.cpp`
* updated `ProcessNewBlock` bench

I added an additional commit, because the new `!fHasMoreOrSameWork && !parent_of_header_candidate` check in `AcceptBlock` can cause `submitblock` (modified in #13439) to mistakingly believe the block is a duplicate.

Added debug log statements to `rpc_preciousblock.py` that helped me figure out the above issue.

issue.title: doc: correct GetDifficulty doc after #13288
issue.body: `chain` is no longer passed to GetDifficulty, and we just return `1.0` if no `blockindex`.

issue.body:
Backported from Bitcoin Core: PR, date-merged-to-master:
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10095 Mar 31, 2017
  - Only the first and third commits.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 Mar 13, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11748 Dec 23, 2017
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151 Jan 4, 2019
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13288 Jun 5, 2018
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10286 Nov 15, 2017
  - Only the `AssertLockNotHeld` commit.
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15932 May 3, 2019

Here's more detail on each of the 13 commits in this PR:

| zcash commit | bitcoin PR | bitcoin commit | PR title | commit comment |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 026f9e6c7834b8feb1b1f467665f97de5fdc5424 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10095 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/e6dcfeec05d6527ab148550836937ff435e6449c | refactor: Move GetDifficulty out of `rpc/server.h` | refactor: Move GetDifficulty out of `rpc/server.h` |
| 9a22560cef1ee4e6d8b3004b016aada4cf79f4c2 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/10095 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/f885b670290d39e697995fd2d35dc36edc104011 | refactor: Move GetDifficulty out of `rpc/server.h` | refactor: Make rest.cpp dependency on `*toJSON` in `blockchain.cpp` explicit |

| 2e5172fd7f3a7212ba5c1324e62b2dd50362e885 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/f814a3e8fa0d99c3d95ae7866c707617a1dd3d4e | Add LookupBlockIndex | Fix cs_main lock in LoadExternalBlockFile |
| 906b9dd459d7a35a83252eb3aca2ad1ed2ed0091 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11041 | https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/92fabcd443322dcfdf2b3477515fae79e8647d86 | Add LookupBlockIndex | Add LookupBlockIndex function |

Bitcoin 0.18 locking PRs
issue.body:
These are locking changes from upstream (bitcoin core) release 0.18 (Aug 13, 2018, to Mar 3, 2019), oldest to newest (when merged to the master branch).

UPDATE 2021-May-4: This PR is complete, ready for review.

NOTE: This PR's branch is based on #5034, which hasn't merged yet, so its commits appear here also. For the current PR, please review only commit "Add missing locks and locking annotations for CAddrMan" and beyond (I will remove this comment before this PR gets merged.)

Each commit also includes a reference both to the PR and the upstream commit.

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13115
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14444
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11634
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13123
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14953
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14993

- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15321
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15201
- https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/15365

comments.body: Why? You can just do a GetAncestor for blockindex->nHeight here, no?
No need to change these unless you're gonna actually kill the cs_main held for the whole time, I'd think, no (and little reason to, its not like its being held for an extended period)?
This way you get next of blockindex.
This moves up tip variable declared below.
Ohoh, sorry, missed its use in blockheaderToJSON.
`tip` instead of `chainActive.Tip()`?
`tip` instead of `chainActive.Tip()`?
Should be `+1` I believe?
Should be `? 1 : -1`. Blocks that are the chain tip have 1 confirmation.
Wrong order, should be `tip, pblockindex`.
Same.
This confused me for a minute too. Maybe could rename function to something like `ComputeNextBlockAndDepth` to mention the `next` part.
Can do, WDYT about returning `std::pair<int, const CBlockIndex*>`?
I can add a comment there too explaning the `height + 1` and `->pprev == blockindex`.
Renamed to `ComputeNextBlockAndDepth` as per @ryanofsky suggestion.
Does return-value optimization not capture this?
I think you are correct.
Indentation isn't consistent this line.
Sorry, indentation fixed.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -51,14 +51,14 @@ extern void TxToJSON(const CTransaction& tx, const uint256 hashBlock, UniValue&
 /* Calculate the difficulty for a given block index,
  * or the block index of the given chain.
  */
-double GetDifficulty(const CChain& chain, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
+double GetDifficulty(const CBlockIndex* tip, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
comments.body:
commit: rpc: Specify chain tip instead of chain in GetDifficulty

I don't think this is really necessary. Would rather just inline `GetDifficulty(blockindex ? blockindex : chainActive.Tip())` at the few call sites if blockindex may be null.

I don't actually see any instances in this file where `blockindex` might be `nullptr`.

@@ -51,14 +51,14 @@ extern void TxToJSON(const CTransaction& tx, const uint256 hashBlock, UniValue&
 /* Calculate the difficulty for a given block index,
  * or the block index of the given chain.
  */
-double GetDifficulty(const CChain& chain, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
+double GetDifficulty(const CBlockIndex* tip, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)

@@ -51,14 +51,14 @@ extern void TxToJSON(const CTransaction& tx, const uint256 hashBlock, UniValue&

  * or the block index of the given chain.
  */
-double GetDifficulty(const CChain& chain, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
+double GetDifficulty(const CBlockIndex* tip, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
comments.body: Yes, I am proposing changing the behavior so that if null is passed it, it returns 1. I think that makes the most sense in the context of this change because you want are removing the dependence of this function on `chainActive`. Given that you are updating every invocation, this seems like the right time to make the change I am proposing.

 /* Calculate the difficulty for a given block index,
  * or the block index of the given chain.
  */
-double GetDifficulty(const CChain& chain, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
+double GetDifficulty(const CBlockIndex* tip, const CBlockIndex* blockindex)
comments.body: Fixed in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12151/commits/92e68393e4e9ab1cdecef976c8500b2e058b9376
From #13602: Can you drop the "to" here.
Sure!

This call could fail the new assert:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/d6faea4f917efdbd6cefe6e91a61c101e20db434/src/rpc/mining.cpp#L217
In rpc code, assert should be replaced with throw JSONRPCError?
I believe `chainActive.Tip()` is always non null.
I don't think this is a usage error, should be a programatic error?
I guess you could avoid the assert by passing in a const reference?
Sure but out of scope here and I'm happy to submit that refactor in a separate PR.
